text: <@U0548MM6B>: we went with the separate modules as this helps enforce the separation - i.e. you can’t accidently use a context in the middle of your domain logic, because the core module does not have an Android dependency

hey guys..
i have a situation…every time i log in to or log out from my app i send informations to my server

the question is: what if the user is already logged in but has no internet connection…what should happen when she/he tries to log out:
1) he/she can’t. log out is only allowed if internet is connected
2) queue the information and send when internet is available
definitely not #1
hehe
thanks
i was wondering if there is any app that i can’t logout if i have no internet connections
a widely spread apps
what kind of information are you sending
informations about the user and an authentication token
why do you need to send that on log OUT
i want to expire the token immediately
and there are some behavior informations also..that is importante to know at the momento of logging out
i guess queue it for next time they’re online
that’s all you can do
That seems ok! I’ll be going on this way : )
i don’t see how you have an alternative
i don’t see it also so far…but i decided to ask because there could be a third option
i’ll queue it and verify it often to check if there is something to be sent once there is internet available
can you have different APKs for each locale? I know you can do multi apk for different phonetypes
i’m not sure but you can choose where your app will be available when you upload to play store..
maybe you can upload 2 different apks and set them to be available to different countries..
is that what you want or i missunderstood?
Sort of. The problem is that we have a DB for each locale, which is around 20MB each. And if we’re supporting 20 locales….
Ok...
Is it a game?
It’s gonna be a giant apk. But I guess you can’t have multiple apks under the same name. Kind of sucks...
no, not a game, just lots of localized data used for offline searching
Ohh ok.. I was gonna ask if you can’t put it online but you already answered
downloading the DB at first run would be an option? because at that moment you already know which DB you should download
I guess there is no good solution, not until the playstore allows diff apk/ locale. Because ideally I would use the SQLiteHelper.onUpgrade() , but I can’t ship an app that’s 300MB!
hmm…why first run is not an option
We currently distribute to TV and mobile with separate apk binaries and one "app" in the play store
so you can upload multiple binaries if you wanted to target different devices, not sure about regions specifically
also true for Amazon's app store
I have also seen a couple 1+GB apps in the play store. Kabam has a few. Not sure the reason behind their exception, though
<@U0CHUGUDN>: is there a way you can download your DB post-install? At that point you'd have the locale and such
Yeah that’s the plan, but leaves the problem of having to support old code forever (until seperating by region becomes a thing)
because the user should still be able to use the app even if their background dowload of the new , localized db hasn’t happened yet
so on every schema change, you have to support the old way of doing things
had a talk with 2 other devs here, we couldn’t figure out a better way. Also found out iOS has same issues :disappointed:
thanks for the help though
